stems.BSC: (to be) an act/instance of play or recreation [both the act and the motivating desire for self-amusement or relaxation]
stems.CTE: (to be) the motivating desire for self-amusement behind an act/instance of play/recreation
stems.CSV: (to be) the physical act of engaging in play or recreation
stems.OBJ: (to be) particular activity/form of play in which one engages [e.g., a game, contest, puzzle, prank, etc.]

stems: (to be) an act/instance of a participatory or self- involved leisure/relaxation activity (activity + psychological motivations behind it), e.g., a dance, a hike, fishing, camping
(to be/manifest) the practice of a hobby or pastime (activity + psychological motivations behind it)

stems.BSC: (to be) an act/instance of playing a formal rule-oriented recreational activity, e.g., a board game, a sport, etc. (activity + feeling of amusement/enjoyment derived)
stems.CTE: (to be) the motivating desire for self-amusement behind an act/instance of playing a formal rule-oriented activity, board game, sport, etc.
stems.CSV: (to be) the physical act of engaging in a formal rule-oriented recreational activity
stems.OBJ: (to be) particular activity/form of play in which one engages [e.g., a board game, individual sport, etc.]

stems: (to be) an act/instance of engaging in an individual (non- team) sporting activity (activity + feeling of competitive spirit) for motive of formal competition, e.g., an individual race, an individual track-and-field event, skiing, competitive shooting, etc.
(to be) a team-oriented sporting activity normally involving equipment [e.g., a court, a playing field, a ball, goal area, projectile playing piece, horse, racket, clubs, etc.]

stems.BSC: (to be) an object used as a required point-scoring object when playing a game or sport [Stem 1 = inflated ball used for throwing, kicking, bouncing, or volleying [e.g., volleyball, football/soccer, tetherball, basketball, European handball, water polo]]
stems.CTE: (to be) the state of an object used as a piece of an equipment in a game or sport being in use or being in play
stems.CSV: (to be) the physical act of touching/handling/using/throwing/placing, etc. the particular point-scoring object while engaged in the particular game or sport
stems.OBJ: (to be) the state (of play) signified by the position/placement/reading or resulting state/outcome [e.g., after being thrown or moved] of an object used as a required piece of equipment when playing a game or sport

stems: prolate spheroid shaped ball [e.g., rugby, American football, Australian football]
hard small ball hit with club or mallet [e.g., golf, field hockey, croquet]
small rubberized ball hit with hand or racket [e.g., tennis, squash, racquetball, jai alai ball, American handball, lacrosse ball]
ball used for hitting with a bat [e.g., baseball, cricket ball]
hard, heavy sphere [e.g., shot, bowling ball]
wiffleball, nerf ball, other ultralight ball
standard 6-sided playing die [i.e., one of a pair of dice]
disc-like playing piece [e.g., for checkers or other board game]
playing marble or other small spheroid playing piece
specially shaped playing piece or game token
game-playing piece consisting of miniature model, picture, or representation of a real-world object [e.g., chess piece]
domino or other stackable playing piece/counter/marker

stems.BSC: (to be) an object used as an accessory or necessary piece of equipment when playing a game or sport [Stem 1 = playing field, pitch, court, rink]
stems.CTE: (to be) the state of an object being used as an accessory or necessary equipment in a game or sport being in use or being in play
stems.CSV: (to be) the physical act of using the particular piece of equipment while engaged in the particular game or sport
stems.OBJ: (to be) the particular state (of play) made possible by the use of the particular piece of equipment

stems: field of play boundary, border, line
base, safe spot/zone of playing field
pegged standard for high jump or pole vault
track-and-field crossbar [e.g., high jump, pole vault]

stems.BSC: (to be) an act/instance of playing/participating in the particular game or sport [i.e., the activity + the feeling of amusement/enjoyment derived] [Stem 1 = chess]
stems.CTE: (to be) the motivating desire for self-amusement behind an act/instance of playing the particular game or sport
stems.CSV: (to be) the physical act of engaging in the particular game or sport
stems.OBJ: (to be) an individual play or move within a particular game or sport

stems: nine-men’s morris / mills / merels/ cowboy checkers
gomoku / renju / five in a row
mancala-type game [e.g., bao, Kalah, oware / warri / ayo / ouril, coro, pallanguzhi, bohnenspiel, cups]
other carrom or billiard like game
switch / last card / two four jacks
mechanical puzzle [e.g., rubik’s cube, puzzle box, folding puzzle, lock puzzle]
red hands / hot hands / slapsies / slap jack
sing-along hand-clapping game [e.g., pat-a-cake / patty-cake, Double Double This This]
Hangman or similar paper-and-pencil-based guessing game
Twenty Questions, Two Truths & a Lie, or similar investigative question game
I Spy or similar guessing game
Psychiatrist or similar role-playing guessing game
“would you rather” or similar choice-based game
Truth or Dare or similar game
arts/entertainment-based [e.g., while watching TV] drinking game
blind man’s buff / blind man’s bluff / Marco Polo
Mother May I? / Captain May I?
Red Rover / forcing the city gates / octopus tag
keep away / monkey in the middle
catch (back-and-forth tossing of ball, frisbee, etc.)
lawn bowling / bocce / boules / pétanque / bowls
other informal throwing or target-based game
volleyball-like sport [e.g., volleyball, sipa, sepak akraw, footbag net, bossaball, jianzi, fistball, wallyball]
ball-over-net game with paddle [e.g., tennis, table- tennis, pickleball]
ball-against-wall sport [e.g., squash, racquetball, American handball, jai alai]
basketball-like game [e.g., basketball, netball, cestoball, korfball, ringball]
baseball-like game [e.g., baseball, softball, rounders, stickball, schlagball, palant, lapta, pesäpallo, oina, elle, tee-ball, wiffleball, brännboll]
field hockey-like game [e.g., field hockey, floorball]
ice hockey-like game [e.g., ice hockey, bandy, broomball, ringette]
other ball-throwing, ball-hitting, ball-kicking or ball-catching game
competitive racing utilizing a non-motorized vehicle/vessel [e.g., cycling, sledding, rowing, sailing]
competitive racing utilizing a motorized vehicle/vessel
competitive racing of inanimate objects [e.g., radio-controlled toy trucks]
competitive racing of animal [not being ridden or harness-controlled by human] [e.g., dog racing]
competitive skill contest involving an animal [e.g., bull-riding]
other sport involving an animal not being ridden or harness-controlled
rodeo event [e.g., roping, bronc rideing, steer wrestling]
eventing or similar activity [e.g., dressage, show jumpint, cross country equestiran jumping]
other sport involving a projectile and target
unassisted competitive sprinting [e.g., sprinting, race-walking, race-hopping]
unassisted competitive endurance running [e.g., cross- country, long-distance running]
unassisted competitive obstacle running [e.g., hurdles, steeplechase]
non-contact tag-based version of contact sport [e.g., tag-rugby, tag-football [American]]
track-and-field jumping/vaulting event (high jump, long jump, triple jump, pole vault)
track-and-field throwing event (discus, shot put, hammer throw, javelin)
highland games throwing event (weight throw, hammer throw, stone put)
highland gamess weight over the bar
rhythmic gymnastic routine (ball, ribbon, rope, hoop, club, ball)
folk wrestling [e.g., collar-and-elbow, Cornish, gouren, kurash, Korean, shuai jiao, schwingen]
kick-boxing style fighting [e.g., sanda / muay thai, pradal serey, lethwei]
